message.content:
cs.IR, cs.MM, cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.SD 

This paper deals with the problem of improving text-based rich-media search, specifically for images and videos. It proposes a concept-driven probabilistic model that takes into account the popularity of clusters or underlying concepts, and explores the possibility of inferring likely concepts from user-created communities. This work involves information retrieval (IR) techniques, multimedia (MM) content, social media (SI) communities, natural language processing (CL), and data mining (SD) to extract relevant concepts. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.IR, cs.MM, and cs.SI, followed by cs.CL and cs.SD.
